channel.title: NPR Programs: Morning Edition
channel.description: Morning Edition takes listeners around the country and the world with multi-faceted stories and commentaries every weekday. Hosts Steve Inskeep, Leila Fadel, Michel Martin and A Martínez bring you the latest breaking news and features to prepare you for the day.
channel.copyright: Copyright 2024 NPR - For Personal Use Only

item.title: U.S. and Iran to hold third round of nuclear talks
item.description: U.S. and Iranian officials will meet Thursday for a third round of talks after President Trump warned of an alleged Iranian threat during his State of the Union address.
item.content:encoded: U.S. and Iranian officials will meet Thursday for a third round of talks after President Trump warned of an alleged Iranian threat during his State of the Union address.
item.dc:creator: Jane Arraf

item.title: Former national security adviser John Bolton discusses risks of Iran regime change
item.description: NPR's Steve Inskeep talks with John Bolton, a national security advisor in President Trump's first term, about the prospect and risks of pursuing regime change in Iran.
item.content:encoded: NPR's Steve Inskeep talks with John Bolton, a national security advisor in President Trump's first term, about the prospect and risks of pursuing regime change in Iran.
item.dc:creator: Steve Inskeep

item.title: Pentagon shifts toward maintaining ties to Scouting
item.description: Months after NPR reported on the Pentagon's efforts to sever ties with Scouting America, efforts to maintain the partnership have new momentum
item.content:encoded:
Months after NPR reported on the Pentagon's efforts to sever ties with Scouting America, efforts to maintain the partnership have new momentum

(Image credit: David Ryder)
item.dc:creator: Graham Smith

item.title: Civil rights leaders say the racial progress Jesse Jackson fought for is under threat
item.description: Activists say racial progress won by the Rev. Jesse Jackson is under threat, as a new generation of leaders works to preserve hard-fought civil rights gains.
item.content:encoded:
Activists say racial progress won by the Rev. Jesse Jackson is under threat, as a new generation of leaders works to preserve hard-fought civil rights gains.

(Image credit: Scott Olson)
item.dc:creator: Debbie Elliott

item.title: 'Get back to integrity': Oklahoma's Kevin Stitt on Republicans after Trump
item.description: NPR's Steve Inskeep asks Oklahoma Gov. Kevin Stitt about his spat with President Trump, immigration and the future of the Republican Party.
item.content:encoded: NPR's Steve Inskeep asks Oklahoma Gov. Kevin Stitt about his spat with President Trump, immigration and the future of the Republican Party.
item.dc:creator: Steve Inskeep

item.title: Morning news brief
item.description: U.S. and Iran to hold third round of nuclear talks, Harvard professor to retire amid school's investigation into his Epstein ties, Cuba says four killed on boat were trying to infiltrate country.
item.content:encoded: U.S. and Iran to hold third round of nuclear talks, Harvard professor to retire amid school's investigation into his Epstein ties, Cuba says four killed on boat were trying to infiltrate country.
item.dc:creator: Michel Martin

item.title: Trump's surgeon general nominee makes her case in confirmation hearing
item.description: President Trump's pick for surgeon general, Dr. Casey Means, is a wellness influencer who is aligned with Health Secretary Robert F. Kennedy Jr. She made her case before a Senate committee Wednesday.
item.content:encoded: President Trump's pick for surgeon general, Dr. Casey Means, is a wellness influencer who is aligned with Health Secretary Robert F. Kennedy Jr. She made her case before a Senate committee Wednesday.
item.dc:creator: Will Stone

item.title: Former Surgeon General Jerome Adams on confirmation hearing for next top doctor
item.description: NPR's A Martinez speaks with former U.S. Surgeon General Jerome Adams about the confirmation hearing for the nation's next likely top doctor.
item.content:encoded: NPR's A Martinez speaks with former U.S. Surgeon General Jerome Adams about the confirmation hearing for the nation's next likely top doctor.
item.dc:creator: A Martínez

item.title: Amid surge in ICE hiring, experts question training methods
item.description: As more ICE agents hit U.S. city streets, law enforcement experts are raising concerns about their training.
item.content:encoded: As more ICE agents hit U.S. city streets, law enforcement experts are raising concerns about their training.
item.dc:creator: Wailin Wong

item.title: Director Hasan Hadi talks about his debut film 'The President's Cake'
item.description: NPR's Leila Fadel interviews writer-director Hasan Hadi about his debut film "The President's Cake," Iraq's official submission for the Academy Awards' Best International Feature Film category. Opening in select theaters on February 6, 2026, and expanding nationwide on February 27, 2026.
item.content:encoded: NPR's Leila Fadel interviews writer-director Hasan Hadi about his debut film "The President's Cake," Iraq's official submission for the Academy Awards' Best International Feature Film category. Opening in select theaters on February 6, 2026, and expanding nationwide on February 27, 2026.
item.dc:creator: Leila Fadel
